Detailed Description

An item-grid may contain a variable number of items, which are displayed inside a vertically scrollable grid. The number of columns may be adjusted dynamically. If the item-grid only has one column, it behaves like a listbox.

The rendering of the items is defined by an instance of the class AbstractItemRenderer, which may be changed by AbstractItemGrid::SetRenderer.

AbstractItemContainer *  item_cont = 0
) 
 

Parameters:
parent Parent control where the item grid is embedded.
item_cont Item container, which specifies the items which should be part of the item grid. If no item container is specified, an item container is allocated automatically internally.

Reimplemented in ItemMenu.

void ItemGrid::SetColumnCount (  INT  count  ) 
 

Sets the number of columns to count. Per default the column count is set to -1, which results in using the number of columns defined by the item renderer properties. The item renderer properties have a default column count of 1, which means that the item grid looks like a listbox.

BOOLEAN ItemGrid::SetProperty (  ResourceParser &  parser,
const GuiObjectFactory::PropertyId  prop_id
) 
 

Initializes the instance by reading out a resource file generated by ARAGON. This method may not be invoked by the MMI in a direct manner and might be changed in future releases.

Reimplemented from AbstractItemGrid.
